laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed presence of conjunctival goblet cells on the corneal surface.
Positive late fluorescein staining in all patients, indicating conjunctivalization.
Normal sensitivity in corneas, lid margins, and conjunctiva.
Bilateral limbal and peripheral corneal scarring and vascularization.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The peripheral vascularization advanced to the corneal surface in four patients during a mean follow-up of 6.1 years.
